intro: Cistanthera leplaei, commonly known as the pink-flowered cistanthera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cistanthera leplaei is often found in heathland and coastal dunes, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
